t: Awake,*pn awake, Clothe*ln yourself in your strength, O Zion; Clothe*ln yourself in your beautiful garments, O*ln Jerusalem, the holy city; For*ln the uncircumcised and the unclean Will*ln no longer come into you.
Shake*ln yourself from the dust, rise up, O*ln captive Jerusalem; Loose*ln yourself from the chains around your neck, O*ln captive daughter of Zion.
For*p thus says the Lord,*s “You were sold for nothing and you will be redeemed without money.”
For thus says the Lord God,*s “My people went down at the first into Egypt to reside there; then the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

Now therefore, what do I have here,” declares the Lord,*s “seeing that My people have been taken away without cause?” Again*i the Lord*s declares, “Those who rule over them howl, and My name is continually blasphemed all day long.
Therefore My people shall know My name; therefore in that day I am the one who is speaking, ‘Here I am.’ ”

How*pn lovely on the mountains Are*ln the feet of him who brings good news, Who*ln announces peace And*ln brings good news of happiness, Who*ln announces salvation, And*iln says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
Listen!*ln Your watchmen lift up their*i voices, They*ln shout joyfully together; For*ln they will see with their own eyes When*ln the Lord*s restores Zion.
Break*ln forth, shout joyfully together, You*ln waste places of Jerusalem; For*ln the Lord*s has comforted His people, He*ln has redeemed Jerusalem.
The*ln Lord*s has bared His holy arm In*ln the sight of all the nations, That*ln all the ends of the earth may see The*ln salvation of our God.
Depart,*ln depart, go out from there, Touch*ln nothing unclean; Go*ln out of the midst of her, purify yourselves, You*ln who carry the vessels of the Lord.*s
But*ln you will not go out in haste, Nor*ln will you go as fugitives; For*ln the Lord*s will go before you, And*ln the God of Israel will*i be*i your rear guard.
Behold,*pn My servant will prosper, He*ln will be high and lifted up and greatly exalted.
Just*ln as many were astonished at you, My*i people,*i So*ln His appearance was marred more than any man And*ln His form more than the sons of men.
Thus*ln He will sprinkle many nations, Kings*ln will shut their mouths on account of Him; For*ln what had not been told them they will see, And*ln what they had not heard they will understand.
